## T32 Predoctoral Scholar

<a href="https://case.edu/medicine/ctsc/education-and-training/t32-predoctoral-training-program/2025-t32-predoc-cohort" target="_blank">2025 T32 Predoc Cohort</a>

I am an NIH-funded T32 Predoctoral Scholar, receiving specialized research training alongside my doctoral studies. This program supports interdisciplinary training in health-related research, with an emphasis on mentorship, methodological development, and responsible research practices. My T32 training complements my broader research interests in genomics, public health ethics, and community-engaged scholarship.

## Justice Dialogues Scholar

<a href="https://www.justicedialogues.org/" target="_blank">Justice Dialogues Website</a>

As a Justice Dialogues Scholar, I have participated in training focused on ethical dialogue, equity, and engagement across difference. This program emphasizes reflective practice, communication, and justice-oriented approaches to scholarly and professional work. My participation informs how I approach collaborative research, community engagement, and ethical deliberation in academic and public settings.

## SING Instructor

I serve as an instructor with the Summer Internship for Indigenous Peoples in Genomics (SING), the U.S.-based program dedicated to training Indigenous students and community members in genomics techniques and ethical research practices.
